title: BATEIA
content:
BATEIA was a Naiad-nymph of the town of Sparta in Lakedaimonia (southern Greece). She was the wife of the
        Spartan king Oibalos (Oebalus).

TYNDAREOS, HIPPOKOON, IKARIOS (by Oibalos) (Apollodorus 3.123)

BATEIA (Bateia) A Naiad of the name of Bateia occurs in Apollodorus. (iii. 10. ยง 4.)

Source: Dictionary of Greek and Roman Biography and Mythology.

Pseudo-Apollodorus, Bibliotheca 3. 123 (trans. Aldrich) (Greek mythographer C2nd
          A.D.) :
        "Oibalos (Oebalus) who was the father of Tyndareos (Tyndareus), Hippokoon (Hippocoon), and Ikarios
        (Icarius) by the Naias Nymphe named Bateia."
